ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] New to online Gaming
ygData.msgSnippet: 1. You can Solo with different chars not all are designed for this. You can always find someone to play with usually.  10-15 hours per week is fine, Trust me,
ygData.messageBody:
1. You can Solo with different chars not all are
designed for this. You can always find someone to play
with usually. 10-15 hours per week is fine, Trust me,
if you can find the time, this will
increase....heheheh
HOW IT WORKS - well you make a char and set out for
adventure , there are lots of quests but get out and
kill BADDIES.....Like I said, you can solo but you
will group and want to for certain things. Sometimes I
just like to jump on and Fletch arrows, so I sit in a
town and Craft away.

2. YES IT IS

3. I have a P2 500 with 316 MB RAM and a 32MB card I
run the EQ trilogy and it runs ok, yours will be fine.
Don't get LUCLIN since the system will run slow. I
have put it on mine and can play but it is TOO slow
for my liking. The trilogy gives you enough zones and
equipment to keep you busy for a while. There is
plenty to do and see. NORRATH is HUGE.

4. Already touched this point.

MOST OF all, ENJOY, and trust me you will, it is a
BLAST.

LET US KNOW what server you choose to play on,

I play on Druzzil RO

Later
Rob

--- quiller64 <jflip64@...> wrote:
> Hi all,
> Having been a fan of computer RPG's for years I am
> considering trying
> EQ. Having never played an online rpg before I have
> a few questions ?
> (Forgive my lack of knowledge and feel free to laugh
> at my questions)
> 1. Being used to playing solo games I could pretty
> much play at my
> own pace. How does EQ work? I know you join other
> online players but
> seeing as I am a casual gamer i only spend 10-15
> hours a week gaming
> is this enough for EQ ? I am assuming that play
> occurs with whoever
> is online at the time and am I not tied into a
> specific group/times.
>
> 2. Is it easy to find other adventurers to join
> with?
>
> 3. I see different EQ's (Original, Ruins of Kharnak,
> etc) does it
> matter which one I start with or are the later
> addons geared for
> higher level characters.
>
> 4 Finally system requirements. I have seen the
> system requirements
> but what is recommended ?. I have a P3 866,
> 128sdram, 32mb ddr nvidia
> geforce2 gts card, 56k modem is that suffiecient or
> should I wait
> till I upgrade.
>
> Thanks for any feedback
>
>
